name: Avoid XML schemas with unbounded occurrences
description: The rule will raise a violation when XML schemas are declared with unbounded occurrence
output:
Associated to each violation, the following information is provided:
- The number of violation occurrences
- Bookmarks for violation occurrences found in the source code
rationale:
Setting maxoccurs as unbounded in xml schema can cause Denial Of Service and expending of resources.

The XMLs typically take huge resources to be processed, if an attacker supplies large number of elements then the system resource processing the XML can be exhausted and lead to DoS.
reference:
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/api/system.xml.schema.xmlschema?view=netcore-3.1

Roger L. Costello Constrain the Number of Occurrences of Elements in your XML Schema

Standards Mapping - Common Weakness Enumeration CWE ID 400, CWE ID 770
remediation: set maxoccurence to a finite value
alternativeName: Avoid XML schemas with unbounded occurrences
